page.title: 04ARABLE FARMING,HUMBIE
page.content: IN OUR SQUARE THERE ARE SIX FARMS POGBIE,HUMBIE MAINS,UPPERKEITH, BLEGBIE,MAVISHALL AND FALA MAINS.ALL FARMS GROW BARLEY,WHEAT AND OIL SEED RAPE.MOST FARMS GROW SILAGE,GRASS AND TURNIP.OTHER CROPS GROWN ARE POTATOES OATS AND PEAS.THERE ARE ONE HUNDRED AND FIFTEEN FIELDS ALTOGETHER IN OUR SQUARE .THE FARMS WITH THE MOST FIELDS ARE FALA MAINS AND UPPERKEITH WHICH HAVE TWENTY ONE EACH.THE SUMMER OF 1985 HAS BEEN THE WETTEST THIS CENTURY.MOST OF THE CROPS WERE FLATTENED AND WINTER FOOD IS SHORT. IT IS NOW THE END OF NOVEMBER AND SOME FARMERS ARE STILL PLOUGHING.THE NATIONAL FARMERS UNION WANT THE GOVERNMENT TO PAY COMPENSATION TO THOSE WHO HAVE LOST THEIR CROP.
